definitions.text: the mental attitude that something is believable and should be accepted as true
examples: he gave credence to the gossip
acceptance of Newtonian mechanics was unquestioned for 200 years

definitions.text: the act of accepting with approval; favorable reception
the state of being acceptable and accepted
examples: torn jeans received no acceptance at the country club

definitions.text: (contract law) words signifying consent to the terms of an offer (thereby creating a contract)
banking: a time draft drawn on and accepted by a bank
a disposition to tolerate or accept people or situations
examples: all people should practice toleration and live together in peace

definitions.text: the act of taking something that is offered
examples: her acceptance of the gift encouraged him
he anticipated their acceptance of his offer
